description: A path by the side of a road for people to walk on.
Marked part of a road where pedestrians have the right to cross.
A narrow road or path between buildings.
A wide street in a town or city, often with trees.
The point where two or more streets cross each other.
A circular place where roads meet and traffic must go around a central island.
A small, round stone used to cover road surfaces.
A broad road in a town or city, typically having trees at regular intervals along its sides.
A street with only one way in and out, ending in a circle.
A long, open area by the sea for walking.
A wide road for fast-moving traffic, with no way for pedestrians to cross.
A narrow road or path, often not for public use.
A place for walking, especially one built next to the sea.
